paragraph.heading:
Liparis viridiflora (Blume) Lindl.
,
Gen . Sp. Orchid. Pl.
: 31, 1830

subSubSection.paragraph:
Basionym:
Malaxis viridiflora Blume, Bijdr. Fl. Ned. Ind.
: 392, 1825.

Gen . Pl.
2: 671, 1891.

77: 39, 2008.

Liparis spathulata Lindl.
, Edwards’s Bot. Reg. 26 (Misc.): 81, 1840. Types :— INDIA . Without locality:

( syntype : not located); “BURMESE EMPIRE”. Without locality:
Griffith 772
( syntype : K-LINDL; isosyntype: K).

Reported from
Kayah and Kayin states by
Kress et al. (2003: 82)
and from Chin State by Saw Lwin (2007: 249) , but we have not seen material from these areas.
Distribution:— Sri Lanka , India , the Himalayas, Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina, southwestern and southern China , Taiwan and Malesia as far east as New Guinea .
